page.title: 01Introduction to the area
page.content: The area lies on either side of the valley of the Dove, which crosses it diagonally from the N.E. to the S.W. The river is the county boundary between Derbyshire and Staffordshire. The disused Buxton-Uttoxeter railway line follows the valley, mainly on the Derbyshire side. This agricultural area is almost entirely grassland, largely dairy but with some sheep, particularly where the ground rises in Staffordshire. The villages in the area are the scattered community of Norbury and the compact village of Snelston. Snelston lies in a secluded side valley south of the Dove. Across the river lies the parts of Mayfield called Middle Mayfield and Church Mayfield. The area is famous for the author of "Adam Bede", George Elliott whose parents are buried at Norbury.
